short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Converts Unicode styled 'fonts' to accessible and readable plain text

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
EXPERIMENTAL: please open a GitHub issue (github.com/wmww/destylize) if you have any problems or feedback

It's become common on social media and elsewhere to use unicode characters that look like bold/italic/etc letters to format text. Destylize converts any of this sort of text it finds on a page back to plain ascii text. This makes accessibility tools like screen readers work better, and make things readable on devices that do not support these special characters.
